mosinstall.name: mosimage
mosinstall.author: Mambo Project
mosinstall.description: Replaces {mosimage} tag in content with specified images

param.name: margin
param.label: Margin
param.description: Margin in px, of Div surrounding Image & Caption - only applies if using a Caption

param.name: padding
param.label: Padding
param.description: Padding in px, of Div surrounding Image & Caption - only applies if using a Caption

param.name: process_img
param.label: Process < img > tags.
param.description: If set, mosimage mambot will look for all < img > and {mosimage} tags in content

param.name: process_img_this_domain
param.label: Process < img > tags from this domain.
param.description: If set, mosimage mambot will look for all < img > tags in content, then will try to extract all needed data from tag and thumbnail it, if needed.

param.name: process_img_other_domains
param.label: Process < img > tags from other domains.
param.description: If set, mosimage mambot will look for all < img > tags in content, then will try to extract all needed data from tag and thumbnail it, if needed. Please notice that it will fasten images loading if server on which mambo is hosted got much better connection that end-user have. Please notice that you should set allow_url_fopen variable to \'On\' in your php.ini.

param.name: default_image_width
param.label: Default image width
param.description: Default image width on page. Will be set if tag will not have width param.

param.name: default_image_height
param.label: Default image height
param.description: Default image height on page. Will be set if tag will not have height param.

param.name: enforce_default_size
param.label: Set all images to default size
param.description: This enforces all images to be

param.name: jpg_quality_frontend
param.label: JPG quality in frontend (0-100%)
param.description: All jpg\'s in admin panel will be sent to output with this quality level.

param.name: output_all_as_jpg
param.label: Output all images as jpg\'s
param.description: Output all other image filetypes as jpgs too
